body:
“THIS HUG IS TERRIBLE”

Villanelle running to hug Konstantin was unexpectedly satisfying. I was like, finally!! It made me realize how much I missed them together. They had a great and funny relationship in season one.

tags: jumping on the analysis train with some thoughts
you can talk about them if you wanna; just don't come into my inbox with hate or anything like that
summary: Just gonna put my two cents out there with a tiny analysis post, but if we compare Villanelle’s obsession with Anna versus the...
body:
Just gonna put my two cents out there with a tiny analysis post, but if we compare Villanelle’s obsession with Anna versus the one with Eve, it seems the one with Eve is more intense and almost entirely different, and given what we’ve seen so far in Season 2, she may not know entirely what to do because of how different it feels to be that into Eve, and so part of her arc this season may be delving into that and all the emotion that gets tangled up with liking someone like Eve.

And then on the other side of that we have Eve, who, up until the end of episode three, has been completely oblivious to her obsession with Villanelle and has most likely been brushing it off as “I’m just doing my job” and then the realization that it’s not just her job, that it’s a real thing, comes not in the form of a brick to the face but a blade in blood red lipstick

summary: The sexual connotations in 2x03 are actually pretty... hysterical if you think about it. For one because sex is used as a...
body:
The sexual connotations in 2x03 are actually pretty… hysterical if you think about it. For one because sex is used as a control mechanism which Eve completely fails to utilize. Secondly, the transactional experience of it; as in, “If you want to show me how much you love me let’s do this”. So, treating sex as currency which absolutely doesn’t work for a married couple such as The Polastris because it’s dishonest, out of line and frankly boring with someone who doesn’t get you. And thirdly, the fact that there hasn’t been much, if at all, focus on Niko’s unsatisfaction in S1 but that “The Hungry Caterpillar” brings forward where his own desires are unfulfilled, and how Eve trades her intimacy with Niko for Villanelle; e.g when Niko comments on masturbating on his omelette, which Eve made, we have Villanelle say this in the scene that follows:

Villanelle’s disgust aside, this is actually an amazing “statement” because who is busy leaving semen stains on things such as his bed? Niko. On a metatextual level seven plus stains would highlight just how removed Eve is from satisfying her husband, to the point that he has to ask for It, “If you wanted to show me your devotion…”, because she won’t bring sex up anymore (see: 1x01). It’s the one thing that he clearly means to hold onto, seeing as their marriage crumbles and his invitation doesn’t work because Eve’s head is, again, somewhere else. That’s very fascinating to me because we watch her make propositions with food, “I just wanted to be nice”, which highlight her own hunger for something she cannot put her hands on yet, and in a way completely opposite from S1 (Eve being on her way to getting closer to Villanelle with the knowledge that whatever connection, affair they have is tied to Love and Death), but it also shows that whatever people tell Eve she still has “worth having”, it has fallen apart already, with little to no space left for her to do something to keep it intact.

This spiel continues when Niko tells Eve to wear a “slutty dress”, which is quite the comment considering at what point he and Eve are in their relationship. It’s an action of transaction again, or how to keep things fresh and entertaining.

But it completely backfires left and right because he doesn’t care about the dress and Eve doesn’t actually care about what a Teacher might go through at school. So with all air out they are left with even more miscommunication. 

Which is truly curious because even though Eve wouldn’t think of sex during the bed scene, we see her try to seduce Niko at the University - “show me your classroom, sir” - because of how much the situation ramps up the possible student-teacher affair. But it feels so out of place still because it’s not only that Eve and Niko are not on the same wavelength anymore (Pythagoras vs Newton) but that the tiniest thing outside of that fake-passionate-Niko-Eve bubble manages to disrupt the entire moment, and in Eve’s mind it’s always tied to Villanelle because Villanelle has planted the seeds she needed to plant in order to occupy all of Eve’s brain, hence the title “The Hungry Caterpillar”.

In fact, it goes even further, to the point that Eve’s feelings for Villanelle spike her senses so high that she blares the freaking alarm in case of an Emergency, which is not as much an Emergency for Eve as it is a way closer to having her own desires fulfilled because Eve knows what she wants for herself even if she cannot admit it yet. This, of course, leaves Niko completely hanging once more:

(I doubt he will come, Eve DJKAHKSJAKDJSAKDJSA)

And then he leaves with Gemma by his side - “You don’t want to be here”. Niko’s observation is correct and it takes shape in actual physical form - distance - as Eve spends her time outside the bed, thinking about Villanelle, whereas Niko has a dream “need to file them alphabetically”. Which, by the way, further intensifies the utter lack of passion and intimacy between them.

Which brings me to the lipstick, or… INDIRECT KISS.

There is a moment where Eve truly asks herself, “What if it was just an apple?”, starting to doubt in which ways she read the scene. But leave it to Villanelle to give Eve the signs she needs. The communication between them is heavy with a charged, clean distance, but it’s passionate nonetheless because Touch is important metaphorically already, and contact is an honest, loaded proposition.

Villanelle - in this case - satisfies Eve on two fronts; 1. her job, the lipstick being the giveaway for the Lift Kill, and 2. that she wants Eve for herself, which is more of an invitation than a threat for Eve to be honest as Villanelle remains the one thing she wants in life as well. All this happens without a second thought too, the primal instinct hurtling them both towards an uncontrollable obsession which is evident in both of their actions (the Konstantin-family affair and Student-Teacher complaints). So one has to wonder, when you faciliate your feelings for someone that long without absolute fulfillment it would be of no surprise if both sides felt like collapsing when only a door kept them apart…

Right? Right.

The noise that came out of my mouth was definitely inhumane lmao.

I have to note how extra TASTY it is that in this world the strongest and most distinguished connection between two characters involves two women. This almost physical contact is so important because they both enjoy reveling in this playfulness (Villanelle’s giggles?), this search and pageantry (and it’s darker incarnation) and that Eve’s relationship with Villanelle is further realized.

So, from a thematic standpoint it is intense already, but it’s also an emotionally indirect-direct sexual experience because here the chemistry is just right, worthy of teasing and pleasure and no-holds-barred comfort in one another’s company. This is explicitly labeled as sensual! Of course Niko doesn’t stand a chance! And the urgency? To get closer but knowing all too well that no, not yet (Villanelle runs)? It’s exciting because Villanelle doesn’t keep Eve hanging, with the lipstick and one last hidden message that Eve literally gets to taste:

SHE DIDNT HAVE TO TOUCH HER LIP LIKE THAT BUT OKAY

“I’m gonna screw you,” tell me who is gonna screw who. I know the answer. But this is what drives me completely insane because we are back to what Konstantin said about Villanelle in the beginning, but it’s not that Villanelle only takes at this point. The thing is that Eve eats Villanelle just as much and I truly think that is like. Beautiful, you know? because KDSJAKSJHAKJHDJKAHDJKSA-

But it completely backfires left and right because he doesn’t care about the dress and Eve doesn’t actually care about what a Teacher might go through at school. So with all air out they are left with even more miscommunication. 

Which is truly curious because even though Eve wouldn’t think of sex during the bed scene, we see her try to seduce Niko at the University - “show me your classroom, sir” - because of how much the situation ramps up the possible student-teacher affair. But it feels so out of place still because it’s not only that Eve and Niko are not on the same wavelength anymore (Pythagoras vs Newton) but that the tiniest thing outside of that fake-passionate-Niko-Eve bubble manages to disrupt the entire moment, and in Eve’s mind it’s always tied to Villanelle because Villanelle has planted the seeds she needed to plant in order to occupy all of Eve’s brain, hence the title “The Hungry Caterpillar”.

In fact, it goes even further, to the point that Eve’s feelings for Villanelle spike her senses so high that she blares the freaking alarm in case of an Emergency, which is not as much an Emergency for Eve as it is a way closer to having her own desires fulfilled because Eve knows what she wants for herself even if she cannot admit it yet. This, of course, leaves Niko completely hanging once more:

(I doubt he will come, Eve DJKAHKSJAKDJSAKDJSA)

And then he leaves with Gemma by his side - “You don’t want to be here”. Niko’s observation is correct and it takes shape in actual physical form - distance - as Eve spends her time outside the bed, thinking about Villanelle, whereas Niko has a dream “need to file them alphabetically”. Which, by the way, further intensifies the utter lack of passion and intimacy between them.

Which brings me to the lipstick, or… INDIRECT KISS.

There is a moment where Eve truly asks herself, “What if it was just an apple?”, starting to doubt in which ways she read the scene. But leave it to Villanelle to give Eve the signs she needs. The communication between them is heavy with a charged, clean distance, but it’s passionate nonetheless because Touch is important metaphorically already, and contact is an honest, loaded proposition.

Villanelle - in this case - satisfies Eve on two fronts; 1. her job, the lipstick being the giveaway for the Lift Kill, and 2. that she wants Eve for herself, which is more of an invitation than a threat for Eve to be honest as Villanelle remains the one thing she wants in life as well. All this happens without a second thought too, the primal instinct hurtling them both towards an uncontrollable obsession which is evident in both of their actions (the Konstantin-family affair and Student-Teacher complaints). So one has to wonder, when you faciliate your feelings for someone that long without absolute fulfillment it would be of no surprise if both sides felt like collapsing when only a door kept them apart…

Right? Right.

The noise that came out of my mouth was definitely inhumane lmao.

I have to note how extra TASTY it is that in this world the strongest and most distinguished connection between two characters involves two women. This almost physical contact is so important because they both enjoy reveling in this playfulness (Villanelle’s giggles?), this search and pageantry (and it’s darker incarnation) and that Eve’s relationship with Villanelle is further realized.

So, from a thematic standpoint it is intense already, but it’s also an emotionally indirect-direct sexual experience because here the chemistry is just right, worthy of teasing and pleasure and no-holds-barred comfort in one another’s company. This is explicitly labeled as sensual! Of course Niko doesn’t stand a chance! And the urgency? To get closer but knowing all too well that no, not yet (Villanelle runs)? It’s exciting because Villanelle doesn’t keep Eve hanging, with the lipstick and one last hidden message that Eve literally gets to taste:

SHE DIDNT HAVE TO TOUCH HER LIP LIKE THAT BUT OKAY

“I’m gonna screw you,” tell me who is gonna screw who. I know the answer. But this is what drives me completely insane because we are back to what Konstantin said about Villanelle in the beginning, but it’s not that Villanelle only takes at this point. The thing is that Eve eats Villanelle just as much and I truly think that is like. Beautiful, you know? because KDSJAKSJHAKJHDJKAHDJKSA-

title: 10 Reasons We Can’t Get Enough of ‘Killing Eve’s’ Jodie Comer | BBC America
excerpt: We really could start and finish this list with one item, that being: Jodie Comer is amazingly addictive as the killer-for-hire Villanelle in BBC...

In my mid-twenties though I'm not quite sure when that happened. _______ This is my little sanctuary. A place where I can rant, flail and cry to my heart's content. I reblog like it's my job and make no apologies for what I watch and ship!

summary: What if the Ghost...is Eve?  We keep talking about her descent into darkness - what if stabbing Villanelle caused some form of...
body: What if the Ghost…is Eve?  We keep talking about her descent into darkness - what if stabbing Villanelle caused some form of dissociative disorder?  She’s always been fascinated with female assassins and now she’s become one.  The profile fits - middle aged, female, non-white.  Niko makes an off-handed comment asking if she’d just murdered someone when Eve brings him breakfast.  Could you imagine the implications for her relationship with Villanelle?  What if…?

blog.name: oksanaastankillme
blog.title: weird but valid
blog.description: I'm Ley and I like women who could kill me.

body:
killing eve spoilers ahead

Just watched ep3 on my lunch break.

I was already pretty sure last season that my favorite dynamic on this show was Villanelle and Konstantin, but this episode confirms it. I’m so glad we didn’t have to wait very long to get them back together. Their scenes were perfect.

Can’t wait for more next week.
